This is not a question of tactic skills. You need to get used to how much structure we use on filters, especially push-forward, pull-back, inf and sup. And of course you need to know the library.

import order.filter.bases order.filter.ultrafilter

open filter set
open_locale filter

variables {X Y : Type*}

lemma ultrafilter.eq_of_le {a b : ultrafilter X} (h : (a : filter X) â‰¤ b) : a = b :=
ultrafilter.coe_injective (b.unique h)

open ultrafilter

lemma ultrafilter_comap_set {f : X â†’ Y} {A : set X} {V : ultrafilter Y} (h : f '' A âˆˆ V) :
  âˆƒ ğ’° : ultrafilter X, ğ’°.map f = V âˆ§ A âˆˆ ğ’° :=
begin
  haveI : (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A).ne_bot := comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem V.ne_bot h,
  refine âŸ¨of (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A), _, of_le _ (mem_inf_of_right $ mem_principal_self A)âŸ©,
  apply eq_of_le,
  calc filter.map f (of (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A))
      â‰¤ map f (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A) : map_mono (of_le _)
  ... â‰¤ (map f $ comap f V) âŠ“ map f (ğ“Ÿ A) : map_inf_le
  ... = (map f $ comap f V) âŠ“ (ğ“Ÿ $ f '' A) : by rw map_principal
  ... â‰¤ V âŠ“ (ğ“Ÿ $ f '' A) : inf_le_inf_right _ map_comap_le
  ... = V : inf_of_le_left (le_principal_iff.mpr h)
end
As you can see, the core of the proof is a computation using all the structure I mentioned. As far as I know, this doesn't exist anywhere else (it certainly doesn't exist in Bourbaki).

  use of (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A),
  split,
  { apply eq_of_le,
    calc filter.map f (of (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A)) â‰¤ map f (comap f V âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ A) : map_mono (of_le _)
    ... â‰¤ (map f $ comap f V) âŠ“ map f (ğ“Ÿ A) : map_inf_le
    ... = (map f $ comap f V) âŠ“ (ğ“Ÿ $ f '' A) : by rw map_principal

If anything is fancy here then it's the anonymous constructor notation (the angle brackets) and its convenient "associativity".

@Eric Wieser : I have broken-up the proof by @Patrick Massot like this:

namespace ultrafilter

lemma eq_of_le {f g : ultrafilter Î±} (h : (f : filter Î±) â‰¤ g) : f = g :=
coe_injective (g.unique h)

def comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem {m : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : set Î±} {g : ultrafilter Î²} (h : m '' s âˆˆ g) : (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s).ne_bot :=
filter.comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem g.ne_bot h

noncomputable def of_comap_inf_principal {m : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : set Î±} {g : ultrafilter Î²} (h : m '' s âˆˆ g) : ultrafilter Î± :=
begin
  haveI : (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s).ne_bot := comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem h,
  exact of (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s)
end

def of_comap_inf_principal_ultrafilter_mem {m : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : set Î±} {g : ultrafilter Î²} (h : m '' s âˆˆ g) : s âˆˆ of_comap_inf_principal h :=
begin
  haveI : (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s).ne_bot := comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem h,
  have : s âˆˆ filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s := mem_inf_of_right (mem_principal_self s),
  exact filter.le_def.mp (of_le _) s this
end

def of_comap_inf_principal_ultrafilter_eq_of_map {m : Î± â†’ Î²} {s : set Î±} {g : ultrafilter Î²} (h : m '' s âˆˆ g) : (of_comap_inf_principal h).map m = g :=
begin
  haveI : (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s).ne_bot := comap_inf_principal_ne_bot_of_image_mem h,
  apply eq_of_le,
  calc filter.map m (of (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s)) â‰¤ filter.map m (filter.comap m g âŠ“ ğ“Ÿ s) : filter.map_mono (of_le _)
  ... â‰¤ (filter.map m $ filter.comap m g) âŠ“ filter.map m (ğ“Ÿ s) : filter.map_inf_le
  ... = (filter.map m $ filter.comap m g) âŠ“ (ğ“Ÿ $ m '' s) : by rw filter.map_principal
  ... â‰¤ g âŠ“ (ğ“Ÿ $ m '' s) : inf_le_inf_right _ filter.map_comap_le
  ... = g : inf_of_le_left (le_principal_iff.mpr h)
end

end ultrafilter
